[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DOS supports order customization, customer data storage, delivery scheduling, and system uptime monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DOS enables doughnut customization, customer data management, delivery scheduling, and uptime monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DOS is designed for customers placing custom orders and managing delivery details.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DOS integrates with customer databases, order processing, and delivery scheduling services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DOS provides a web-based UI for order customization and checkout.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DOS operates on cloud-based servers, supporting desktops, tablets, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DOS uses React.js frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL for data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DOS optimizes storage for customer preferences and order history.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: DOS manages authentication, order customization, checkout, and delivery scheduling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DOS ensures real-time system availability with automated uptime monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DOS connects to order processing, delivery tracking, and customer management APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 MISSING-TAG2: DOS ensures secure data transmission using TLS 1.3.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DOS requires an internet connection for real-time order processing and tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DOS relies on secure payment processing, cloud storage, and system uptime.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Delivery Scheduling: Setting pickup date and time.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 MISSING-TAG1: The Doughnut Ordering System (DOS) defines requirements for order customization, delivery management, and system availability.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall provide an interactive UI for order customization and checkout.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall securely store customer details, including name, contact, and email.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for seamless order customization and checkout (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to customize doughnuts by selecting fillings, toppings, and decorations via an interactive interface (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to review available doughnut selections before ordering (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable users to specify a pickup date, delivery time, and location (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process and confirm orders within 5 seconds (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store customer orders, preferences, and delivery details (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure accurate order customization and scheduling.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain 24/7 availability for order placement and tracking (REQ-DSGN-001, REQ-COMP-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to data security and encryption best practices.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Order processing, customization, and delivery scheduling validated through system testing.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and data security policies.
[SEC] 5. References: E-commerce standards, UI best practices, and data encryption guidelines.
